result.execSummary:
The defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Julius Vanashan Lacey was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Julius Vanashan Lacey is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Julius Vanashan Lacey was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs and surcharge, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Provide  DNA sample if not already done, pay for any costs.
Court advised due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the agen has approved a modification to No Violent contact.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 664
cf

Defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 150 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 months, concurrent with extended supervision.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Defendant provide a DNA sample if not already done, and pay for any costs.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.  Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 36 for a probation review hearing on 10/30/2015 at 01:30 p.m..

Defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court recalled the case on the record.  
The defendant has submitted a waiver of jury trial and wishes to proceed with the court trial.
Court trial proceeded.
Sworn in for the State:  Samantha B.
Exhibit 1 marked and received into evidence.
Sworn in for the State:  MPD Officer, Daniel Clifford.  State rests.
Defense rests.
Closing arguments heard.
Defense motion to dismiss is denied by the Court.
The Court found the defendant NOT GUILTY of Court 1 in the Criminal Complaint.
Court found the defendant Guilty of Disorderly Conduct, Count 2 of the Criminal Complaint.
The parties are asking to proceed to sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded....

Defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court called the case on the record.  
The court met at side bar with the parties.
Case passed......

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Jury Trial. Defendant NOT produced from MSDF. Case adjourned to allow defendant to be produced for trial. Case ajdouren to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey NOT in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak, in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Jury Trial. Parties ready to proceed to trial, case passed to address Court Calendar.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS before the Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Julius Vanashan Lacey in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
